website_summaries.verdict: Smaller cousin in the Norelco series packs a similar punch in a portable, travel-friendly device. Floating heads contour to your face for a clean shave.
pros: Independent floating heads follow your face's curvature for a close and precise shave
Self-sharpening blades increase time in between replacing heads
Battery operated, so you can shave while on the go
Comes with travel pouch for storage
cons: Not recommended for heavy daily use, but perfect for travel

customer_reviews.title: I beat the crap out of this thing and it's still going strong
customer_reviews.text: I used to take this out in the field when I was in the military, and it never let me down. It lived in the little pocket on my trousers near my boot, and got soaked in mud and sweat, banged up against countless objects, dusted with sand and dirt, and still provided a consistent, if sometimes uncomfortable (due to the sand and all) shave. The batteries would last well over a month, and little more than a rinse of the blades/foil and the occasional oiling was required to keep it going. A very reliable, compact, and inexpensive shave. I'm very happy with this razor.
customer_reviews.author: Z. Shearin

customer_reviews.title: Great Battery Travel Shaver
customer_reviews.text: Better than expected. Ran over two weeks with daily use. When power gone, does not function (no slowdown prior). I use same brand with superior cutter heads, so this not expected shave as close. BUT functions quickly and without any special face cleaning (wake and shave). Cleaning head is easy and does not need too often; I always removed head and tapped out cuttings. Only Concerns: (1) pushing up switch ON can loosen/pop-off Cutter Head, and (2) head's Plastic Cover easy to come off (I used rubber band over Plastic Cover down to bottom of shaver). Overall great product and price.
customer_reviews.author: Ed-diy

customer_reviews.title: No Travele case included
customer_reviews.text: I just received the below. I orderedit specifically because its a convenient size for travel and the case that comes with it. To my surprise, there was no case... even though the description clearly states there is: What’s in the Box Philips Norelco Shaver 510 Protective Cap Cleaning Brush 2 AA batteries Travel Case
customer_reviews.author: DR

customer_reviews.title: Cuts close but..
customer_reviews.text: I'm shocked at how close of a shave this razor gives me! I'm a woman and this works great on my legs compared to other travel razors I've used. It definitely works far better than those cheap Clio foil shavers I used to use. I really like this razor for shaving my lets but it is not good to use on your arm pits or other sensitive areas of the body. It cut my arm pit:/
customer_reviews.author: TheeGrace

customer_reviews.title: Dont look like a zombie when dooms day comes. Good for no power shaving
customer_reviews.text: I use it for off grid having when camping and traveling. Great for power failures too. Its good enough for travel use for me. See Video. I also did a comparison video with a Panasonic battery operated shaver that cost twice as much You can see that review by searching on youtube for COSMO WEEMS SHAVER
customer_reviews.author: Cosmo Weems

customer_reviews.title: Caused bodily harm to myself, made me bleed, caused scars all over my neck
customer_reviews.text: At first I really liked this product, but after about 60 uses, it hurt me. It caused severe cuts about 20 small cuts on my neck, each cut not deep, but each cut was bleeding. It was extremely painful. Now there are scars all over my neck. I would not have purchased this product if I knew about this problem. This product injured me, and made me feel pain.
customer_reviews.author: k

customer_reviews.title: Great for sensitive skin.
customer_reviews.text: If you've never had an electric razor do yourself a favor and get this one to get you started. I have pretty sensitive skin and I have never had a problem with this. Naturally, skin gets a little red after use, but it goes away in 5 minutes. Now, don't be an idiot and pretend this razor to shave a long, thick beard. Shave with Gillette razor first and then use this one every morning to keep the clean shave. If you go more than 24 hours without using it you will most likely have to shave with razor again. Great shaver!
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, easy to use, works well, great maneuverability!
customer_reviews.text: This item was purchased as a gift and shipped right to the recipient's door! I bought this for my mother-in-law that is disabled and not able to get around very well. She absolutely loves it! She says that it's extremely easy to use, small and easy to maneuver, and works wonderfully. Said it was just what she needed to take care of everything she needs it for. Her husband can use it on his beard as well. Very versatile, doesn't take up much room, lightweight, and perfect for on the go. They were both extremely pleased with it and I am glad she enjoyed her gift!
customer_reviews.author: Bittrswe3t

customer_reviews.title: Smoothest electric razor I've used
customer_reviews.text: Unbelievable smooth razor. Smaller and perfect for travel. Fits in a pocket if you want. Battery operated so no cord to remember to bring. That's why I bought this razor. On a trip, I forgot the cord for my razor and it was going to cost me $15. I bought this Philips 2 head #510 for $17 and I'm so glad I did as it does a better job than the 3 head Remington I have at home. I read from other reviews that the batteries last for a few months so this will be handy for traveling to Europe or anywhere. And if I need to replace them, 2-AA's are readily available anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Mike C

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't last long!
customer_reviews.text: My husband likes this shaver and I have purchased a few because they are reasonably priced but not again...they work for a while and then don't do a good job....the last one I bought for him and of May is bad after less than 2 months...never again....
customer_reviews.author: Camokitty

customer_reviews.title: Self destructed....
customer_reviews.text: I was removing the plastic head guard as I have many times. The head came off in the guard. Fine. I removed it and put the razor back together. No biggie, right? Wrong. The spindles won't connect with the blades any more. I double checked for missing parts. Nada. It just won't connect anymore and there seems to be no reason why. It runs. It just won't shave. I had to dig out my little old emergency razor I bought in 2001. It still works. I'm the only one who has access to the razor so no one else could have messed with it unless someone broke into my house and used it. Think I'll try a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Philocrates

customer_reviews.title: This shaver cuts them down like nothing. Easily shaves as close as my expensive ...
customer_reviews.text: I don't have a beard. I have wire brush bristles. This shaver cuts them down like nothing. Easily shaves as close as my expensive Norelco triple header. The posters who say they have to go over and over their face to get a shave are probably cheaping out and using non-alkaline batteries. Wish I had discovered this item a long time ago.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Should be USMC standard. Wheres the case!?
customer_reviews.text: If you're a Marine, buy this. This is the best field razor I've ever owned in 14 years of field shaving through the dirt and camo paint on the last day. It shaves close, wont turn on in your pack (small "safety" button), and takes AA instead of recharge. I'm on my 3rd one in a decade and have no plans to change. Only complaint is that it used to come with a semi-rigid zip up case. I have my old one so dorsnt affect me but its not as good without it as the head will pop off in your pack periodically. If you can find the case separately buy it.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: I Have Tried A Several Different Models & This Is Definitely The Best
customer_reviews.text: I have been using different models of these small, inexpensive razors for several years. My initial investment is but fraction of the cost of an electric razorn and when they stop performing well it is cheaper to buy a new one than to buy new cutters for the high priced razor. I thought I had found the perfect razor for me, but then I read about this razor in Consumer Report and decided to try it. It's as good or better than the one I have been using and a lot quieter. So now I have a new favorite, one that is going to be very hard for a comperitor to improve. This is a very good razor.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Depree

customer_reviews.title: Son's preference over shaving.
customer_reviews.text: I gave this to my son a month ago, since then he has only used this shaver and has not touched the shaving cream and razors. It is still running on the same battery that was installed the day he received it and still seems to be running powerfully. The cut seems to be close, since he has not complained and I have not noticed any stubble.
customer_reviews.author: Margarita Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic little razor!
customer_reviews.text: usually get this at the store but it was unavailable. ordered it here and it was perfect in the package brand new and sealed. works great so far. i have had a few of these. replacement set of 3 blades is $26, replacing this entire razor, is only $15. i just replace the entire thing. this is my 4th. (1st from this seller) they always work great and last more than a year. the mechanics of the razor have never broken in that time on any of them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great compact shaver
customer_reviews.text: I leave this at work, and it's come in handy on numerous occasions. At first I was annoyed that it uses regular AA batteries. I have a set of rechargeable AA batteries and it works great. You can use this quite a bit before needing to replace the batteries. It's small enough to throw in your backpack or leave in a drawer at work. It cuts well, close and comfortable. I highly recommend this shaver. In fact I have a full sized Norelco that has three heads and is rechargeable and I don't use that one at all anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Hanuman

customer_reviews.title: Small, light. Gives an acceptable shave. Single pair of AA cells lasted 3 weeks.
customer_reviews.text: Great for traveling. Gives a pretty good shave, though not as good as the 3-head Philips I use at home. Just returned from a 3-week trip, and it was still working on the original pair of AA cells — though admittedly it was taking longer to give the same quality of shave. I checked out getting some replacement heads in case I need them some time in the future. It turns out that the heads come in a 3-pack, and they cost more than the complete shaver. So if the heads ever get blunt I’ll just replace the whole thing!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: a great little shaver
customer_reviews.text: I went to visit my parents for a couple of weeks and forgot to bring my normal shaver. i bought this one and had it shipped to my parent's place and used it for about 10 days. the shaver shaves good, takes longer to shave due to its small size. the battery lasted the trip and probably few more weeks. it will definitely be in my bag for the next trip.
customer_reviews.author: JG

customer_reviews.title: Small and convenient
customer_reviews.text: I am able to get a close shave with this shaver. Multiple passes are needed under the chin and on the neck but it does the job. Very portable and the AA batteries last for at least 10 shaves depending on how long you run the razor for each shave. I used packing tape to attach the cleaning brush to the cap that protects the rotary heads. It would be cool if the cap was engineered to have a brush attached that slides out for cleaning and retracts when storing.
customer_reviews.author: S. Tisdale

customer_reviews.title: Great little portable shaver
customer_reviews.text: Surprised this isn't more popular. Works as good as the big 3 head shaver. Maybe better. Battery life with rechargeable batteries is at least 2 weeks of almost daily use. Small size stores and travels easily. The protective cap falls off easily which is annoying. Great value.
customer_reviews.author: ConstantCritic

customer_reviews.title: Lighter than a corded version
customer_reviews.text: PROS: * Lighter than a cordered Norelco even with the batteries (weighed it) * Great for traveling abroad CONS: * Little difficult to get used to 2 blades instead of 3. NOTES: * Get a protective case for it. One drop and it might break however it feels solid.
customer_reviews.author: Mark P.

customer_reviews.title: Great little travel shaver or backup
customer_reviews.text: Used this with pre electric shaver lotion. Compared to Braun 7. I'm convinced that this actually shaved closer. By a slight margin. Took a little longer than Braun but not much. Surprised how how well it worked. Bought as a shaver for on the road traveling. If not traveling get the 1000 model for 29.99. it's corded and won't run out of juice when plugged in and has same shaver heads. After a few sets of batteries I think corded one would end up being cheaper by year's end. Good shaver for a two headed model.
customer_reviews.author: joseph

customer_reviews.title: still gives a great shave. 2 AA Batteries last a long time ...
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this little shaver at least five years; still gives a great shave. 2 AA Batteries last a long time in it. I use it about every other day or so when I don't feel like using a blade and for touchups. Works good for that purpose; I don't think it would be good for someone with thick whiskers, but my facial hair is fairly fine so it works great for me.
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: Great little travel razor.
customer_reviews.text: This works great for travel. I agree with other posters about AA batteries being a better solution than screwing around with recharging. I can grow a beard by 10:00 a.m. so I need to use it daily. It's not a 1 pass (at least on my face) but its about equivalent time to shaving; I'll probably get more efficient the more I use it. Does not pull my hair nor irritate my face! It was a little more powerful and quicker I'd give it 5 stars, but it does the job and is compact for travel.
customer_reviews.author: Scott S.

customer_reviews.title: Very light weight and when running doesn't feel like it has enough power to do a very good ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item not really expecting much.....I was pleasantly surprised. Very light weight and when running doesn't feel like it has enough power to do a very good job, but it does. Out-performed the travel razor I previously owned. Don't expect a barbershop close shave, but be confident it can handle the daily touch-up that one may need time to time. So far very satisfied with the razor. Still pretty new so we'll see how it performs from here on.
customer_reviews.author: dan

customer_reviews.title: Knockoff for twice the price?
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what I received here, but the last two shavers I bought were not packaged like this one. This looks like a cheap knock off of the original. Very disappointed because I paid more than twice for it. Please refer to the photos. the one that has phillips norelco is the one I had before.
customer_reviews.author: Reynold Tirbany

customer_reviews.title: OH SO HAPPY WAS SHE
customer_reviews.text: OUTSTANDING ITEM - I GOT IT FOR MY WIFE AS THE OLD ( PHILIPSAVER TYPE HP 1214 6V DC TOOK 4 AA BATTERIES ). SOME HOW THE BATTERIES LEAKED AND THE SHAVE DIED. AS SOON AS I PUT THE TWO AA BATTERIES IN THE UNIT MY WIFE TRIED IT. OH SO HAPPY WAS SHE. SHE SAID THIS NEW ONE WAS SO MUCH BETTER THEN THE OLD ONE, WHICH WAS 45 YEARS OLD. I WAS VERY HAPPY THAT I FOUND THIS NEW SAVER. THE PRICE WAS GREAT AND IT VERY CONFORTABLE IN THE HAND WHEN USING IT.
customer_reviews.author: irvin small

customer_reviews.title: Good little travel razor
customer_reviews.text: Good little travel razor. I would have given it five stars but the plastic cap that snaps over the blade end for safe traveling does not snap very securely and will pop off with just a slight touch. Norelco needs to put a bit more effort into designing this so this cap stays on more securely while traveling with it.
customer_reviews.author: Rex the Cat

customer_reviews.title: Buy the Panasonic instead
customer_reviews.text: The razor didn't seem to like to run well...ie. very slow. also gave me razor burn. Had to do over with the Panasonic. You have to clean the Norelco with a brush, the Panasonic cleans by just holding it under a running faucet. The Norelco says to keep dry. You can shave in the shower with the Panasonic. No contest IMHO>
customer_reviews.author: Greg H

customer_reviews.title: Light, Compact, Inexpensive
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent razor, but it's not suitable for daily use. It's very small and light, powered by 2 AA batteries, so it's ideal as a travel/pocket/backup razor. However the blades do not spin so fast, and it feels like it would struggle if there is a lot of hair to cut. I usually use it to trim my beard when it's relatively neat, otherwise it would be hard to shave with this razor if you have anything more than a goatee. The "holes" that the hair enters seem standard enough, it's the blade speed/sharpness that is lacking. Not a bad razor, but more suitable as a backup/travel razor.
customer_reviews.author: MOJO

customer_reviews.title: My second one
customer_reviews.text: Nice little razor that was great for traveling. First one I bought for $10 and left it in a campground rest room. So had to replace if for a trip overseas and cost me 50% more without a travel case! Enter the Ziploc sandwich bag. Used it every day for 6 weeks on a trip to Austria and never had to recharge it. No TSA issues either. Am going to keep closer tabs on this one!
customer_reviews.author: remote camper

customer_reviews.title: Great so far
customer_reviews.text: I'm still on the first two batteries and cannot believe how many shaves I've received from them so far. Although it takes more work than my Remington to shave, I'm getting used to it. The main reason I ditched the Remington was because the screen continually needed replacing, which cost more than the razor. The recommendation on this shaver is to replace the heads once a year.
customer_reviews.author: Evert Boer

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING LITTLE TRIMMER!
customer_reviews.text: This little thing is a complete game changer! I now don’t have to resort to shaving with a razor, but instead trim my mustache and small beard! It’s quite, a bit heavy (I very much fell in love with this), and well put together. The heads come off when needed for cleaning without being too difficult to put back together!
customer_reviews.author: Leonardo Cabral

customer_reviews.title: What a wonderful little machine
customer_reviews.text: This thing really works. It's so small and is driven by 2 AA batteries and I thought for the price I'd take a chance on it but my expectations were low. Was I surprised! This little thing cuts my truly tough beard very closely and does it gently. Although I don't shave everyday, I bought it 5 months ago and it still has the original batteries in it. And the size....It fits in the palm of my hand. I can carry it in a pocket and not know it's there. It's great for carrying in the car and shaving while I'm being driven to work. I am totally sold on this shaver and highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: bisjack

customer_reviews.title: This is much better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: This is much better than I expected. I never had much luck with the rotary style and have been using the foil shavers for years. Found this for a good price and the reviews are good. Pretty good little shaver after 5 shaves and I like it better than my old foil shaver. For the price I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: morphine

customer_reviews.title: Small motors and blades. Imagine what that can do on thick hairs.
customer_reviews.text: Worst product that I ever bought. This will pull hair without shaving cream. For those who have red hair beards DO NOT BUY.
customer_reviews.author: Snowboarder

customer_reviews.title: It is great for a touch up and never irritates his skin
customer_reviews.text: My husband had surgery and the Dr. said not to use a regular blade razor. He had never used an electric razor before and wasn't sure about it but had no choice really. Now he loves it. It is great for a touch up and never irritates his skin. He now uses it more often than his regular razor. I recommend this product. You get a lot more for your money than you expect.
customer_reviews.author: Teaco

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the money
customer_reviews.text: It is unfortunately cheaper to buy another one of these, instead of buying replacement parts (blades) I sharpen the blades myself (with metal polishing compound, see youtube videos) Cleaning is easy, just put the heads in some soapy water and let soak. Thanks to 2 (larger than AAA) AA batteries, the shaver lasts a very long time.
customer_reviews.author: pianogod

customer_reviews.title: Tiny but mighty!
customer_reviews.text: I just got this razor in the mail minutes ago, and am already in love with it! It's the perfect size to fit in my hand, the razor itself works phenomenally. Easy to clean, and it's great that it has batteries so it is always accessible. Perfect travel size. Very precise shaving. One thing to suggest, is to exfoliate before you use this razor, as electric razors can't take care of ingrown hairs for you. Makes a world of a difference. This one is a keeper!
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised
customer_reviews.text: I shave with a blade every day and this won't change that, but it seriously reduces five o'clock shadow after work. Quiet and comfortable shave, but not very smooth. Works fine with rechargeable batteries.
customer_reviews.author: scottalias

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Shaver
customer_reviews.text: I bought this shaver and the Panasonic ES-RS10-S, and like them both. This one is quieter, a bit larger and probably a little easier on the face. Hard to tell, but the Panasonic may give a slightly closer shave. This claims to have self-sharpening blades, so that may be an advantage. I have a medium beard, and either shaver gives me an adequate shave. Unless I shave with a blade to get really close (and maybe nicked), I'll stick with these.
customer_reviews.author: T. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Spend more money and get a better shaver.
customer_reviews.text: This shaver did not work well at all. It would just pull hair instead of cutting it.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: I have two now
customer_reviews.text: The second one I bought. I have one for home and one for travel is the perfect size to throw in your gym bag. Top comes off easy to clean. Doesn’t really pull the hair but leaves a very nice clean-cut. The only bad thing I was is the cover for the top (not The battery top) because of the top to protect where the Blades are. Wish they sold this as a set.
customer_reviews.author: Cedrick Juarez

customer_reviews.title: in a pinch I've tried it and it sucks as far as I'm concerned
customer_reviews.text: Reviews of this item say it is under-powered, but I haven't noticed that. My plug-in every day electric razor is a $20 unit; this battery operated one actually compares favorably to my plug in one. It being under-powered would depend on your frame of reference I suppose: if your every-day shaver is a $50-100 unit maybe this one is indeed relatively under-powered. An additional consideration: I much prefer spinning heads on my shavers, so am accustomed to getting them to shave close. My roommate uses one with a flat foil and swears by it; in a pinch I've tried it and it sucks as far as I'm concerned. Just something to think about.
customer_reviews.author: Colton

customer_reviews.title: Grooming basics
customer_reviews.text: I put it in my grooming basics bag. I know it's a travel one, but I can use it however I wanna use it. It can quickly get rid of out of place scrappy facial hair. Pretty good to use under the chin as well. If you use it fairly quickly, not like in and out quick, but more like a minute or two of use per mornings, it won't eat much battery. Super portable too.
customer_reviews.author: Aldee

customer_reviews.title: Works.  beats taking a cord or charger.
customer_reviews.text: Started making noise after the second use. Quite noisy this one. I've bought this model at least 4 time before this. Took one across the Sahara on a dirt bike. Somethings wrong with this one. Foil shavers do a better job quicker, except conair, junk. But, rotary is quieter. Braun is my favorite foil shaver. aa battery power shavers are best for travel.
customer_reviews.author: Joe/Lulu

customer_reviews.title: Hubby uses as his daily razor
customer_reviews.text: The hubs has tried all brands of electric razors in the past 30 years. He has several moles on his face and alternates electric and manual razors. This little razor works better than any of the expensive electric razors I have gifted him over the years. He loves this so much that I bought him another one to keep at our summer home
customer_reviews.author: Kim DeRoest

customer_reviews.title: Returned it
customer_reviews.text: I found the razor was weak and it did not shave with good enough power.
customer_reviews.author: R S

customer_reviews.title: best portable battery shave available.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these shavers for over 18 years. NOTHING works as well as these. Very difficult to find them in the U.S...- I'm thinking there's some weird monopoly going on here. I only initially found them in New Zealand at the time and thought I'd try it- never looked back. these would sell like hotcakes in the U.S. if people knew they were an option (conspiracy theorists discuss...)
customer_reviews.author: GCMRN

customer_reviews.title: I like it...a lot.
customer_reviews.text: Handy little shaver. I have always liked Norelco products....they never failed me. This tiny little shaver work well for me. I shaves nicely. Though the included battery is a little weak, put in a couple Energizer Lithium AA's, and this thing fires up nicely and hear the little thing roar..lol. So far so good. Can't wait to take it on my next trip.
customer_reviews.author: MikeA

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: An amazingly good shaver. I've had a number of electric shavers, and this is by far the best Ive tried. I've even had other norelco shavers of very similar design, but somehow this one is better--shaves quicker, closer, and more comfortably. The batteries seem to last forever (though my beard isn't particularly heavy). Before this I always ended up going back to using a blade after a few tries, but now I only use this one. They recommend replacing the cutting heads about once a year, but the heads cost more than the shaver, so I'll probably just buy a new one when the time comes--I hope they keep making these.
customer_reviews.author: Taranome

customer_reviews.title: Good little razor
customer_reviews.text: Good little razor, and cheap. Two AA batteries, very low-tech. I bought it to stuff in my backpack and use while traveling overseas on a 10-day vacation, thinking I'd just leave it behind, but haven't chucked it yet. Good when you're in a hurry or don't want to deal with wet shaving. You can find similar items that are cheaper, but I didn't want bottom-of-the-barrel cheap, and I'm pretty happy with this little guy.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Akard

customer_reviews.title: Slow speed but excellent shave.
customer_reviews.text: I use this every day. I owned a battery-powered Norelco shaver years ago, and it was great. I have also owned a Norelco triple-header, and other plug-in name brands as well. Nothing has ever worked as well for me as a Norelco. I think it is probably the design of the heads. This little razor has a weaker motor than other portables I've had, but it is much quieter, and shaves very well over all. The slower speed is not enough to reduce this shaver from five stars. It does a great job.
customer_reviews.author: F.J. Foster

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good- close enough for the weekend
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good for a travel shaver. I am caucasian, and have a pretty heavy beard. This works okay- I use it mostly on weekends and casual travel. For work, I will continue to use a blade to shave. I do not feel it is close enough for a work shave.
customer_reviews.author: Tom D.

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT TRAVEL RAZOR
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a backup razor; it’s really a perfect travel razor, or for people who prefer a battery option for ease of just changing power source. The 2 razor heads are typical Norelco style blades in round covers. I really recommend this for people who prefer the Phillips Norelco (3 head) electric razor. The feel is excellent and the cleaning easy. I have had good longevity with the 2 AA batteries required.
customer_reviews.author: Major T.Top Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: A good razor for using at home not traveling
customer_reviews.text: It is a good razor if you plan on using it at home, but I would not recommend it for traveling as it was designed to do. The clear plastic cover covering the head comes off at the slightest jostle, and because of it, I lost it within a month of use. Secondly, the head itself comes off very easily, on multiple occasions after traveling, I found it came off and there were shavings all over my shaving kit. So I just kept it at home most of the time.
customer_reviews.author: S. Li

customer_reviews.title: perfect for travel
customer_reviews.text: Bought for extended trip overseas, and wanted battery powered so I don't have to mess with transformers etc. Tested on a two day beard, its works fine, is very small, easy to pack. I have used Norelco for many years, and of course the three head razor is going to be faster, but this little one works just fine
customer_reviews.author: JSK/Florida

customer_reviews.title: No longer works after 5 months
customer_reviews.text: I bought this shaver in July 2018. It worked great but as of this morning it died. A waste because it does work well....when it works at all.
customer_reviews.author: jrc1971

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Shaver!
customer_reviews.text: I have had a similar two head travel shaver I bought in Europe that outlasted two Norelco Architec's and shaved much better. Cost 25$US. I see that this model does the same.....shaves better for my light beard better than any razor I've tried! Kinda odd, but it works great. I thought you had to spend over a $100 to get a good shaver.....wrong!
customer_reviews.author: M.Jones

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: What I have come to expect from Philips quality. My first Philips product was purchased in 1955. I have never been disappointed by their quality. This shaver is a replacement after I dropped a corded shaver (to its ruin!). I use rechargable batteries and they last quite a while before needing recharging.
customer_reviews.author: Geoffery L.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for traveling
customer_reviews.text: Because it uses 2 AA batteries that are available everywhere, you don't need to get a voltage/plug adapter to recharge.
customer_reviews.author: John1965

customer_reviews.title: Good price and shaves well
customer_reviews.text: My old Norelco gave out abou a couple good decades of duty. I prefer 2 head electric over the 3 head and this was the best I could find. It is very small and would be convenient for travel. Unfortunately it is a little too small for my hands. I have trouble holding it and a lot of trouble cleaning the heads because of the size. It does shave well but I probably would not have bought it if I had realized how small it was. My fingers are simply too big and clumsy. Still was a decent buy. Not their fault I have bad fingers.
customer_reviews.author: Dwayne Montgomery

customer_reviews.title: but I like it so much that I have made it my ...
customer_reviews.text: I originally purchased this shaver for use during travel, but I like it so much that I have made it my only shaver. Battery life has proven to be quite good with Duracell alkaline batteries. I am curious if it will work with lithium batteries and hope to try that soon.
customer_reviews.author: enr

customer_reviews.title: Just barely ok as a travel stubble fix.
customer_reviews.text: This little razor is a bit underwhelming. It is not terrrible, not great, just barely ok as a temporary travel fix for mid day stubble. I do not recommend at all as a primary razor. I have owned another major brand travel razor bought in the mid 1980s which is a very similar size and design but which has about 50% greater power and that makes all the difference. Not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: NSJ

customer_reviews.title: This is perfect. I use Sony rechargeable batteries in it
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect. I use Sony rechargeable batteries in it, and they last several months. I'll never buy another plug-in razor. Update: I've been using this for four years now, all the time. That is, not just for travel. But it's also great for travel because I don't have to worry about what kind of outlet I'll have to plug into. Nothing has worn out or broken. I used to have a Norelco "triple-header", and this works just as well.
customer_reviews.author: JimT

customer_reviews.title: As good as a big one
customer_reviews.text: This razor is just as good as a big one. I find that this razor is better than any other razor. It is very easy on the budget, stays working longer than the big expensive razors, is easy to use and carry on trips. I no longer use any other razor.
customer_reviews.author: kenocat2

customer_reviews.title: Takes too long to do it's job
customer_reviews.text: My husband was looking for something to take on the road. So after reading some reviews and checking out other ones. I decided to purchase this for him. At first he was happy and ready to use it. But that happiness did not last long. He said it does it's job but it takes forever to get there. He said it would be faster to use shaving cream & razor. That the only good thing about it. Was it wouldn't take up too much room when packing. Beacause of it's size.
customer_reviews.author: terrortink

customer_reviews.title: it's just great.
customer_reviews.text: I use this every day whether traveling or not. I power it with Eneloop rechargeables so there is no need for a rechargeable shaver. I have soft skin and a light beard and this cleans my face up to the nth degree, it's just great.
customer_reviews.author: Radio Buff

customer_reviews.title: Great little razor for travel or even for home
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace the same model I've owned for years. The old one is still running great but I couldn't find replacement blades anywhere but for the price of a new one I just bought a second. It shaves as close as a larger much more expensive electric razor I have & cleaning is super easy.
customer_reviews.author: travlreadr

customer_reviews.title: Handy travel razor
customer_reviews.text: My husband was looking for a travel razor, and this one was a nice find. The razor is compact and works well, though there are a few things to keep in mind: - There are only two heads rather than the three heads on a standard Philips Norelco razor, so it may take you longer to shave - Despite being compact, the razor is rather heavy with the batteries in - No travel case is included Overall, it's a very nice travel razor, especially if you're accustomed to using a regular Philips Norelco razor at home.
customer_reviews.author: Nina

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work when I received shipment of this product.
customer_reviews.text: I inserted the included batteries correctly (+ to +) and it wouldn't turn on. Thinking the batteries were defective,I tried my own batteries and no luck. I called Amazon troubleshooters and they said they would refund my money and that I didn't have to return it. I was told to reorder it, but I will look for another model.
customer_reviews.author: L

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product!
customer_reviews.text: My husband who doesn't need much shaving loves this. His last one lasted years and years. He is so happy to have a replacement. If you're travelling, take the batteries out in case something knocks it into "on" position which happened once when he had his old one.
customer_reviews.author: P.C.

customer_reviews.title: Bought this 4/20/2018
customer_reviews.text: Its still working after 2 years. You need to tune it up every couple of months I put oil on it but, it still getting da job done. 8/23/2020 finally stop working. 1 ofda razors stop spinning then started making a noise. I took it apart cleaned it & it even though it was acting like it normally would. It stop shaving. It lasted me 2 years , 3 months, 3 days, 7 hours, 47 minutes, & 24 seconds RIP....
customer_reviews.author: PARTYBOI8512

customer_reviews.title: Have razor will travel..
customer_reviews.text: This is the second travel razor that I purchased for my husband. Order the exact same model. The only reason this is the second go round is because my husband literally worn the first one out. We travel a lot and the size is so convenient, it does a great job ( for the size), the price is great, and the quality is outstanding. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Gail C.

customer_reviews.title: May want to keep a couple of batteries on hand
customer_reviews.text: Nice compact size for traveling. No cords or charger to take up valuable space. The rotary heads work just like my full size razor and the top comes off for easy cleaning. Two spare AA batteries will find their way into my kit.
customer_reviews.author: PAUL UNDERWOOD

customer_reviews.title: this thing is amazing for the price
customer_reviews.text: this thing is amazing for the price! I was using a braun series 5 razor before this, and didnt have high hopes when i bought this to go in my travel bag. on the flatter parts of my face (cheeks) the braun did a noticable better job, but on the nooks and tight areas, this one beat the braun hands down. overall shave is actually close to being even between them. the braun was only slightly better, but not enough that my wife could tell the difference between me using that or this one. this should be a wonderful razor for anyone, and should do well for those that just need a basic shave.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Dead on arrival
customer_reviews.text: Major dislike is that it does not work! I thought the Phillips AA batteries were just bad so I put in two new batteries still DEAD on arrival warranty? Not worth the my time and effort. I just cannot trust Phillips products, I will never buy their products again.
customer_reviews.author: L. Atkeson

customer_reviews.title: Does the job but not the best.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this shaver because it's small and light and uses AA batteries, which are readily available. After using this shaver during a 4-week trip I find it shaves pretty close. But to shave close you have to spend a long time over the stubbles. That's because the rotary blades and motor are so weak. I also have the Panasonic travel shaver, which is a lot more powerful and does the job in half the time. Given my experience with both I prefer the Panasonic one much more - and it's shower proof. This Norelco does the job but falls short of the competition.
customer_reviews.author: Traveling man

customer_reviews.title: Sharp Blades.
customer_reviews.text: Nice little razor. Shocked by time as price seems high nowadays but its blades are sharp. You can hear and feel the sharpness. If you need to shave twice a day you will appreciate this little shaver. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: zm_star

customer_reviews.title: Yank and tank
customer_reviews.text: Switched from the travel braun to this one. Thought it would be as good, but it wasn't. Not enough speed on the shaver and it ends up pulling whiskers. Have to use a lot of circular motion to get a small area shaved. Doesn't do well if it's a couple of days of growth. Will be switching back to the braun travel model, tossing this one in the tank.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Dawn

customer_reviews.title: Handy Travel Razor
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this handy travel razor for about four months on and off. It's small and compact. I put lithium long lasting batteries in it and they are still going strong. As some others have noted, it is very quiet. It may take a bit longer to complete the shave but that's OK with me. Good value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Lenny OKN

customer_reviews.title: Works reasonably well
customer_reviews.text: I'm pleased with this little shaver. It works well enough for me. A bit on the slow side but the batteries seem to keep it chugging along, and the batteries last long enough. For the money and performance I'm happy with it and would buy another.
customer_reviews.author: Knotmename

customer_reviews.title: it works well and is quiet.
customer_reviews.text: I like the size. Does the job and close shave. I use three..one for the bathroom, one for the office, and another one in the car as to be clear shaven all the time. Every guy should buy three of these shavers..Brand name and they are small too..also great for traveling.
customer_reviews.author: Richard A. Hing

customer_reviews.title: Great electric shaver
customer_reviews.text: For the price, you can't beat it. This gives you a reasonably close shave and is best in its category in my opinion. I also have the Panasonic travel shaver which is nice and gets the job done but I find this one to give me a consistently closer shave and do it quicker. This is my daily go to now after using it on the road and loving it, easy to hold and no need for cords around the sink anymore given battery power. Overall a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: AI

customer_reviews.title: No Experience with Battery Life But..
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice little travel shaver and will be part of my travel kit for sure. It’s pretty smooth and fairly close but certainly not blade close. It shaves me at least closer than the Norelco One Blade.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Sprague

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product ESPECIALLY for the $
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in 2014 and am still using it. I use a hand razor sometimes and this others. When traveling this is all you need. It has a ergonomic feel, recharges quickly- and hols the charge. Maybe not the closest or fastest but do you really want to spend more than this price.
customer_reviews.author: BikeMike

customer_reviews.title: The price was right (so far)
customer_reviews.text: Although I have not used this razor too many times, my first impressions were very positive. I was especially pleased with how quiet it is. It is very light weight, but seems to be well made. I realize that this is a very incomplete review, but I have only used this a few times, but I do like it.
customer_reviews.author: Cambrian

customer_reviews.title: Mechanically sound; poor ergonomic design.
customer_reviews.text: It shaves well and has a good battery life, but it is a very poor ergonomic design. The roundness of the shaver does not pack well (it doesn't stay in place and slides around), it's somewhat difficult to hold on to due to the taper of the body and the on/off switch is right where your thumb ends up when you hold it so it will inadvertently gets shut off in use. (And the on/off switch doesn't click into place.) I like Norelco products, but not this one. My old 105DB model was far better than this one.
customer_reviews.author: BJ

customer_reviews.title: Awesome electric shaver
customer_reviews.text: I've tried travel shavers in the past and I've never been happy with them. They either don't get a good, close shave, or they have problems getting all of the hair (missing spots that I have to go over several times), or they take too long. This shaver has none of those problems. It is the only electric shaver I have EVER liked. I used it daily, batteries last quite a while.
customer_reviews.author: GaryG

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: If you're considering cost-effectiveness it's a clear 5/5 stars because it works just as well as larger, more expensive trimmers I've owned. Surprisingly powerful enough to get through 2-3 days of stubble. If you compare to other trimmers without considering the price tag however, I'd said 4/5. It still causes pinching if you're not careful and you still need to spend quite amount of time on the curves and nooks and crannies of your face to make sure you're actually getting everything.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Aderhold

customer_reviews.title: This is weak. If you have peach fuze this will work. A 5 o'clock shadow guy this is a weak shave.
customer_reviews.text: For the price not bad but I have a tough beard and it couldn't widdle it away. Did cut it down some. I got to try to soften it up after shower method. Maybe shaving cream too. Maybe you will get a seal and vacuum on it. Says not to rince under water or has icon in plastic. Maybe for dry shaving only.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I don’t need a super expensive one when this one works just fine
customer_reviews.text: I have to shave everyday for work and disposable razors are expensive. I wanted a cheap electric razor to help me shave quickly and for less. This was it. I have never used an electric razor before so I had no idea what the difference was going to be between this and those really expensive hundred dollar plus ones. But now that I’ve tried this, I don’t care. I don’t need a super expensive one when this one works just fine. Yes, you have to go over the same area a few times and the neck can get tricky but for the price, I’m happy.
customer_reviews.author: ChrisK

customer_reviews.title: Great travel shaver
customer_reviews.text: The only thing I wasn’t happy with is there is no place to store the cleaning brush like on some other items. The shaver itself is fantastic, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Great shave
customer_reviews.text: This is a great shaver. The shave is great. The only problem that I run into is that it turns off easily while shaving. I just have to be careful when holding the shaver. I like the fact that the batteries are replaceable. When the batteries fail on other shavers, they are very expensive to replace.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Neumann

customer_reviews.title: It was ok except it did poorly where the whiskers grew in different directions like some places on my neck
customer_reviews.text: I used to carry a cheap battery foil razor in my car for emergencies and misses. It was ok except it did poorly where the whiskers grew in different directions like some places on my neck. I decided to replace it with this cheapo circular. Bottom line is I was so happy with the ease, closeness and convenience of having this in my car, I switched to a mid priced rechargeable circular for in-house everyday. Every man should keep one these AA wonders in the glove box.
customer_reviews.author: Amazinon

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Good: VERY CONVENIENT Compact and clean cut Extremely easy to clean Honestly an amazing little trimmer Bad: Short battery life. I've had it about 2 months and I've had to swap out the AA batteries twice now
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Wegner

customer_reviews.title: I just need one for the office and I will continue as the happiest man in this world
customer_reviews.text: I have two, on in my car and another at home, I just need one for the office and I will continue as the happiest man in this world. the cost it is very cheap and the use and quality excellent. I use it every day since 1980.... the first ones was blue color, now brown but the quality still very good.
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo A. Nunez S.

customer_reviews.title: CLOSE SHAVE, SMALL SIZE
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly good shaver for such a small product. It provides a fast, reasonably close shave. I'm still running on the original batteries, so I can't give an opinion on battery life.
customer_reviews.author: Reg

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: 1 to 10 (heaviest) my beard would be a 8 with a neck prone to ingrown hair. This razor is perfect for evening touch ups and a morning shave in a clutch. As mentioned in other reviews use light pressure when shaving and use the talc stick found here:  This is not the best shaver but the best $12 shaver. But if you only need an occasional touch up it is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Well Read

product_meta.title: Philips Norelco PQ208/40 Travel Electric Razor
product_meta.description: Color:NOThe Philips Norelco Electric Razor Travel Model provides a clean shave on the go. With self-sharpening blades, this Travel Electric Razor provides a close shave each time it is used. It also features independently floating heads that follow the curve of your face. In order to operate this Philips Electric Razor, two AA batteries are required (included).
feature_bullets: Up to 60 minutes cordless shave. Battery operated (2 AA batteries included; Best with Polaroid AA Batteries)
Self-sharpening blades for a close shave
Independently floating heads follow the curve of your face
Self-sharpening blades for a close shave
Independently floating heads follow the curve of your face

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars2,844 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
